intro: Oncostemum triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Oncostemum triflorum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
